content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.13 - Executive Order No. 13: Ordering the Director of the Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to Bar the Diversion Under the Probation-Eligible Diversion Program of Felony Sex Crime Offenders from State Prison Sentences. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, it is the first obligation of government to
protect its citizens from crime and violence; WHEREAS, the Probation-Eligible Diversion Program, formerly
known as Operation 360, provides funding for enhanced community-based
supervision and treatment for probation-eligible, non-violent felony offenders
who have not previously been convicted of a felony offense and who otherwise
would have received state prison sentences; WHEREAS, the Probation-Eligible Diversion Program is
intended to increase the available capacity in the correctional system for
violent felony offenders without jeopardizing public safety; WHEREAS, although certain felony sex offenses are not
denominated "violent felony offenses" under the Penal Law, they are often
committed by means of violence and are highly traumatic crimes that inflict
grievous psychological harm even when their commission does not entail actual
violence; WHEREAS, the Probation-Eligible Diversion Program does not
presently bar the diversion from state prisons of persons convicted of felony
sex offenses; and
WHEREAS, there is a high degree of recidivism associated
with sex offenses and public confidence in the Probation-Eligible Diversion

Program would be seriously undermined in the event that a felony sex offender
was diverted under the program from a state prison sentence and committed
another sex offense despite community-based supervision; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby order the State Director of the

Division of Probation and Correctional Alternatives to issue all necessary and
appropriate directives to bar the diversion under the Probation-Eligible

Diversion Program from state prisons of felony sex offenders. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: April 28, 1995
